final_answer:
The humor in this image comes from contrasting expectations. The left side shows a large, colorful, and healthy salad overflowing from a bowl, suggesting an abundance of healthiness. A small silhouetted person next to it emphasizes its size and appeal. 

On the right side, labeled "BUT," a person is seen pouring a large amount of dressing over a smaller, sparse salad. This undermines the healthy aspect of the salad by illustrating how excessive dressing can negate its benefits. 

The satire lies in the common tendency to turn a healthy meal into something less healthy by adding too much dressing, humorously highlighting how people can sabotage their good intentions.
